frameDefinitions: A Locale is characterized by the type of entity associated with the Locale.
This frame has to do with people (the Residents) residing in Locations, sometimes with a Co-resident.
An Patient, which is an organic substance, undergoes the natural process of decay due to a Cause (or Agent).
A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration.
This frame contains words which name permanent fixed structures forming an enclosure and providing protection from the elements.
A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
frameExamples: This neighborhood started out as a Russian <t><fex name='loc'>enclave</fex></t>.
I usually <t>stay</t> with my aunt at her summer house when I go to Seville.
The baroque <t>church</t>, built in 1635, has a very rich interior
listRoleDefinitions: A stable bounded area characterized by properties of the entities who are typically located there (e.g., work and/or live there).
A property or characteristic of the entities in the <fen>Locale</fen>.
The individual(s) that reside at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The place in which somebody resides.
A person or group of people that the resident is staying with or among.
This role refers to the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Resident</fen> resides.
The <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally brings about the decay of the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Patient</fen> undergoes decay.
An event which causes the <fen>Patient</fen> to rot.
The time at which the Cause causes the <fex name='Patient'>Patient</fex> to rot.
The location at which the <fen>Cause</fen> acts upon the <fen>Patient</fen>.
The <fen>Guest</fen> remains for a relatively short period of time in the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Location</fen> where the <fen>Guest</fen> spends a short amount of time.
The length of time that the <fen>Guest</fen> remains at the <fen>Location</fen>.
The <fen>Host</fen> is living at the <fen>Location</fen> on a permanent basis, and is allowing the <fen>Guest</fen> to stay there.
The time at which the temporary stay takes place.
The <fen>Place</fen> indicates the larger physical setting of the temporary stay.
The entity built by the <fen>Builder</fen> which has some <fen>Function</fen>.
The building's location.
<fen>Protagonist</fen> identifies the being or entity that is  dead or alive.
This role identifies the <fen>Figure</fen> or form being described by the target.
The time in which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is dead or alive.
listRoleExamples: A twenty-minute walk will take you to the Dutch-speaking <fex>quarter</fex> of the city.
A twenty-minute walk will take you to the <fex>Dutch-speaking</fex> quarter of the city.
Originally, <fex>we</fex> planned on rooming with our relatives in Reno.
Originally we planned on staying <fex>at the Hilton</fex>.
My wife and have just returned from a <fex>two day</fex> stay at Ocean Key.
You should avoid staying <fex>with old college buddies</fex> when on business trips.
<fex>In London</fex>, I stayed at a hotel.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the end of the eighteenth century
the end of the previous year
Apostolic Exarch for the Eastern-Catholic Church
the Sacred Congregation de Propaganda Fide
